definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb

sentences.english: Flora manhood had to shift her dead arm .
sentences.chinese: 弗洛拉曼胡德把發麻的雙臂交換了一下位置。

sentences.english: Her voice gets on my nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲音今我頭皮發麻。

sentences.english: Chew the gum slowly until it tingles.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢咀嚼尼古丁含片，直到感覺發麻。

sentences.english: If you have pain and numbness or if the color of the fingers turns pale or dark, come right away.
sentences.chinese: 如果手指疼和發麻或顏色發白或發暗，就馬上來診治。

sentences.english: The first kiss with his girlfriend first love, she whole body tingling .
sentences.chinese: 第一次與初戀女友接吻，她全身發麻。

sentences.english: Your heart is racing, your head spinning, your hands tingling.
sentences.chinese: 你的心跳加速，天旋地轉，手臂發麻。

sentences.english: The horror movie is so scary. It made his hair stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 這個恐怖電影特別嚇人，嚇得他頭皮發麻。

sentences.english: But every time I here too, scalp tingle.
sentences.chinese: 但我每次從這裏過，都頭皮發麻。

sentences.english: He burnes his tongue with red pepper.
sentences.chinese: 他的舌頭被紅椒辣得發麻。

sentences.english: This movie is so scary that I get tingles down my spine every time I see it.
sentences.chinese: 這部電影很恐怖，恐怖到我每次看都會感到脊椎發麻。

sentences.english: It creates a tingling sensation in your fingertips, a flutter in your heart and warmth in your belly.
sentences.chinese: 它使你指尖發麻，心頭亂跳，胃裏一暖。

sentences.english: The noise of the explosion made his ears numb.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸的聲音震得他耳根發麻。

sentences.english: What can I do for the numbness in my feet?
sentences.chinese: 當我的腳發麻的時候，我可以怎樣做？

sentences.english: The horror movie was so scary. It made his hair stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 這電影特別嚇人，嚇得他頭皮發麻。

sentences.english: My scalp tingled with her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲音令我頭皮發麻。

definition: to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
